first_reading.title: 1st book of Kings
first_reading.text:
[[1_R 19,16]]The Lord said to Elijah: "You shall anoint Elisha, son of Shaphat of Abel-meholah, as prophet to succeed you."
[[1_R 19,17]]If anyone escapes the sword of Hazael, Jehu will kill him. If he escapes the sword of Jehu, Elisha will kill him.
[[1_R 19,18]]Yet I will leave seven thousand men in Israel--all those who have not knelt to Baal or kissed him."
[[1_R 19,19]]Elijah set out, and came upon Elisha, son of Shaphat, as he was plowing with twelve yoke of oxen; he was following the twelfth. Elijah went over to him and threw his cloak over him.
[[1_R 19,20]]Elisha left the oxen, ran after Elijah, and said, "Please, let me kiss my father and mother good-bye, and I will follow you." "Go back!" Elijah answered. "Have I done anything to you?"
[[1_R 19,21]]Elisha left him and, taking the yoke of oxen, slaughtered them; he used the plowing equipment for fuel to boil their flesh, and gave it to his people to eat. Then he left and followed Elijah as his attendant.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 9,51]]When the days for Jesus to be taken up were fulfilled, he resolutely determined to journey to Jerusalem,
[[Lc 9,52]]and he sent messengers ahead of him. On the way they entered a Samaritan village to prepare for his reception there,
[[Lc 9,53]]but they would not welcome him because the destination of his journey was Jerusalem.
[[Lc 9,54]]When the disciples James and John saw this they asked, "Lord, do you want us to call down fire from heaven to consume them?"
[[Lc 9,55]]Jesus turned and rebuked them,
[[Lc 9,56]]and they journeyed to another village.
[[Lc 9,57]]As they were proceeding on their journey someone said to him, "I will follow you wherever you go."
[[Lc 9,58]]Jesus answered him, "Foxes have dens and birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to rest his head."
[[Lc 9,59]]And to another he said, "Follow me." But he replied, "Lord, let me go first and bury my father."
[[Lc 9,60]]But he answered him, "Let the dead bury their dead. But you, go and proclaim the kingdom of God."
[[Lc 9,61]]And another said, "I will follow you, Lord, but first let me say farewell to my family at home."
[[Lc 9,62]]Jesus answered him, "No one who sets a hand to the plow and looks to what was left behind is fit for the kingdom of God."

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 16,1]]Keep me, O God, for in you I take refuge;
[[Ps 16,2]]I say to the LORD, “My Lord are you.”
[[Ps 16,5]]O LORD, my allotted portion and my cup, 
you it is who hold fast my lot.

[[Ps 16,7]]I bless the LORD who counsels me; 
even in the night my heart exhorts me.
[[Ps 16,8]]I set the LORD ever before me; 
with him at my right hand I shall not be disturbed.

[[Ps 16,9]]Therefore my heart is glad and my soul rejoices, 
my body, too, abides in confidence
[[Ps 16,10]]because you will not abandon my soul to the netherworld, 
nor will you suffer your faithful one to undergo corruption.

[[Ps 16,11]]You will show me the path to life, 
fullness of joys in your presence, 
the delights at your right hand forever.

second_reading.title: Letter to the Galatians
second_reading.text:
[[Ga 5,1]]Brothers and sisters: For freedom Christ set us free; so stand firm and do not submit again to the yoke of slavery.
[[Ga 5,13]]For you were called for freedom, brothers. But do not use this freedom as an opportunity for the flesh; rather, serve one another through love.
[[Ga 5,14]]For the whole law is fulfilled in one statement, namely, "You shall love your neighbor as yourself."
[[Ga 5,15]]But if you go on biting and devouring one another, beware that you are not consumed by one another.
[[Ga 5,16]]I say, then: live by the Spirit and you will certainly not gratify the desire of the flesh.
[[Ga 5,17]]For the flesh has desires against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; these are opposed to each other, so that you may not do what you want.
[[Ga 5,18]]But if you are guided by the Spirit, you are not under the law.
